snippet: Friday's parliamentary elections in Iran, in which reformists have been barred from standing, have been called "a farce." In what is billed as a battle between conservative factions, will the regime have to rig the results to make sure they turn out...
abstract: Friday's parliamentary elections in Iran, in which reformists have been barred from standing, have been called "a farce." In what is billed as a battle between conservative factions, will the regime have to rig the results to make sure they turn out right?
